title: Add habit reordering and persist sort order
description: Implement manual reordering for habits and persist sortOrder updates so order remains stable across launches.
design: Interaction design locked: long-press on the currently centered habit page enters reorder mode. The selected card compresses and becomes draggable in a temporary vertical stack overlay of habit cards. Neighboring cards animate in from top and bottom. Reorder mode disables horizontal page swipe and double-tap completion. Plus page is excluded from reorder mode and remains a trailing non-reorderable page in browse mode. Dropping exits reorder mode back to full-page layout.
acceptance_criteria:
- Long-press only activates on currently centered habit page.
- Reorder overlay contains only habits (no plus page).
- Dragging reorders canonical sortOrder and persists across relaunch.
- During reorder, paging and completion gestures are disabled.
- Edge auto-scroll works near top/bottom during drag.
- On release, UI returns to full-page browse mode with moved habit selected.
notes: Ordering behavior: drag/drop updates canonical habit sortOrder, not completion-group order. Pager rendering remains completed first then incomplete, while preserving canonical sortOrder within each group. Keep selection on the moved habit after drop. Use edge auto-scroll when dragging near top/bottom screen edges (non-scrollable list with edge-driven movement).
close_reason: Added centered long-press reorder mode with draggable vertical stack, edge auto-scroll, and persisted canonical sortOrder updates

- Lint/build pass after refactor.

title: Add emoji selector for habits
description: Replace free-form emoji entry with an emoji picker flow on habit pages and persist selected emoji to Habit.
design: Emoji architecture decision: each habit must always have exactly one emoji. Emoji selection should use picker-driven assignment (no empty state) and persist immediately to Habit. Input validation should normalize to a single visible grapheme cluster.
acceptance_criteria:
- Every active habit has exactly one emoji at all times.
- Creating a habit assigns a default emoji immediately.
- Emoji picker changes persist to SwiftData and survive relaunch.
- Invalid multi-character/free-form input is prevented by UI flow.
notes: Switched to ElegantEmojiPicker package for dynamic Unicode-backed emoji set and built-in keyword search. Replaced static custom emoji list picker; defaults remain enforced (one emoji required, reset disabled, default=✅️).
close_reason: Added emoji picker flow, enforced one-emoji default, and normalized emoji persistence for all habits

title: Add reversible completion transition animation on double-tap
description: Animate completion toggle with center-out green circle, emoji/checkmark replacement, and reversible strikethrough motion.
design: Animation decision for double-tap completion toggle: from center of emoji area, animate an accent/green circle expanding outward. Simultaneously, current emoji fades out while shrinking to 0; SF Symbol checkmark fades in while growing to the emoji's prior size. Habit title strikethrough animates left-to-right when completing. Reverse toggle should run smoothly in the opposite direction with strikethrough right-to-left and icon swap reversed.
acceptance_criteria:
- On complete: center-out green/accent circle animation is visible.
- On complete: emoji fades+shrinks out; white checkmark fades+grows in to same final size.
- On complete: strikethrough animates left-to-right.
- On un-complete: animation reverses smoothly; checkmark->emoji swap and strikethrough right-to-left.
- Animation remains smooth and coherent under repeated quick toggles.
notes: Visual clarifications locked: checkmark is white over the green/accent circle for contrast; reverse animation is exact directional reverse when un-completing.
close_reason: Added reversible completion transition animation with center-out circle, icon swap, and animated strikethrough
